item.description: Hey Twitter, you are a media entity now — embrace it http://t.co/CjdAELo #technology #news
item.content:encoded: Hey Twitter, you are a media entity now — embrace it http://t.co/CjdAELo #technology #news Twitter's 100 million active users may pale in comparison to Facebook's half a billion, but then Twitter isn't really a social network -- it's a real-time information network. In other words, it's a media entity, and the sooner it starts acting like one the better. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Lee Cronin: Making matter come alive | Video on TED.com
item.description: Today's TEDTalk: Chemist Lee Cronin explores the nature of life through an elegant experiment in creating... http://t.co/N2SLYpB
item.content:encoded: Today's TEDTalk: Chemist Lee Cronin explores the nature of life through an elegant experiment in creating... http://t.co/N2SLYpB TED Talks Before life existed on Earth, there was just matter, inorganic dead "stuff." How improbable is it that life arose? And -- could it use a different type of chemistry? Using an elegant definition of life (anything that can evolve), chemist Lee Cronin is exploring this question by attempting to create a fully inorganic cell using a "Lego kit" of inorganic molecules -- no carbon -- that can assemble, replicate and compete. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ted.com
